Package ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers.EventController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/events") public class EventController extends Object
Restful api service that receives http requests about the Events in the calendar.
Author:
Anna Aba

  • Constructor Details

    • EventController

      public EventController()

  • Method Details

    • getAllEvents

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllEvents(@RequestParam(required=false) String start, @RequestParam(required=false) String end)
      Returns all events (not active also) from the database. Two optional params - start and end date-time of event. If both parameters exist - then the function returns all events in this range.
      Parameters:
      start - date-time of event.
      end - date-time of event.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of events.

    • getEventsByUserId

      @GetMapping("/user/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventsByUserId(@PathVariable("id") int userId, @RequestParam(required=false) String start, @RequestParam(required=false) String end)
      Returns all events of an user. Two optional params - start and end date-time of event. If both parameters exist - then the function returns all events of an user that in this range.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id of the user.
      start - date-time of event.
      end - date-time of event.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of events of user.

    • getFutureEventsByUserId

      @GetMapping("/user/{id}/future") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getFutureEventsByUserId(@PathVariable("id") int userId, @RequestParam(required=false) Integer minutes, @RequestParam(required=false) Integer hours)
      Returns all future events of an user. Two optional params - minutes and hours. If both parameters exist - then the function returns all future events of an user that coming the next number of minutes and hours.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id of the user.
      minutes - the next number of minutes.
      hours - the next number of hours.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of future events.

    • addEvents

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addEvents(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events, @RequestParam(required=true) int userId)
      Adds list of new events of an user to the database. For each event, adds default notification.
      Parameters:
      events - list of new events.
      userId - the id of the user.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the list of new events and their default notifications.

    • updateEvents

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateEvents(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events, @RequestParam(required=true) int userId)
      Updates list of existed events of an user in the database.
      Parameters:
      events - list of events to update.
      userId - the id of the user.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the list of updated events.

    • addGuestsToEvent

      @PutMapping("/{id}/guests") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addGuestsToEvent(@PathVariable("id") int eventId, @RequestParam(required=true) int userId, @RequestBody List<Integer> guestIds)
      Adds the event to each guest-user from the guests list. Also for each guest, adds a default notification for this event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the id of the event.
      userId - the id of the user who is the owner of this event.
      guestIds - list of ids of the guests.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of the guests with their updated event-list.

    • softDeleteEvents

      @DeleteMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> softDeleteEvents(@RequestBody List<Integer> eventIds)
      Deletes events by switching their isActive flag to false.
      Parameters:
      eventIds - list of ids of the events to delete.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of deleted events.

    • hardDeleteEvents

      @DeleteMapping("/delete") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> hardDeleteEvents(@RequestBody List<Integer> eventIds)
      Deletes events completely from the database, and theirs notifications also.
      Parameters:
      eventIds - list of ids of the events to delete.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of deleted events.
